00041 #include <stdio.h>

00048 /* Invert an nxn (n < 5) square matrix using the adjoint matrix method.      */
00049 /*  Dimension limited to at most 4 because of data structure matrix.         */
00050 static matrix I =
00051 {
00052    { 1.0, 0.0, 0.0, 0.0 },
00053    { 0.0, 1.0, 0.0, 0.0 },
00054    { 0.0, 0.0, 1.0, 0.0 },
00055    { 0.0, 0.0, 0.0, 1.0 },
00056 };
00057 
00058 void invmat(matrix mat, matrix inv, int n)
00059 {
00060    real detA;
00061    int  i, j;
00062 
00063    detA = determ(mat, n);
00064    for (i = 0; i < n; i++)
00065    {
00066       for (j = 0; j < n; j++)
00067       {
00068          inv[j][i] = cofactor(mat, n, i, j) / detA;
00069       }
00070    }
00071 }
00072 
00073 /* Calculate cofactor of element ij in matrix mat. */
00074 real cofactor(matrix mat, int dim, int i, int j)
00075 {
00076    real   tmp;
00077    matrix minor;
00078    int    m, n, k, l;
00079 
00080    for (m = k = 0; k < dim - 1; k++)
00081    {
00082       if (m == i)
00083       {
00084          m++;
00085       }
00086       for (n = l = 0; l < dim - 1; l++)
00087       {
00088          if (n == j)
00089          {
00090             n++;
00091          }
00092          minor[k][l] = mat[m][n];
00093          n++;
00094       }
00095       m++;
00096    }
00097 
00098    tmp = determ(minor, dim - 1);
00099    return((i + j) % 2 == 0 ? tmp : -tmp);
00100 }
00101 
00102 /* Calculate determinant of matrix. */
00103 real determ(matrix mat, int dim)
00104 {
00105    real sum;
00106    int  i;
00107 
00108    if (dim == 1)
00109    {
00110       return(mat[0][0]);
00111    }
00112    for (sum = 0.0, i = 0; i < dim; i++)
00113    {
00114       sum += mat[0][i] * cofactor(mat, dim, 0, i);
00115    }
00116    return(sum);
00117 }

00119 /*** Calculate the matrix product m = m1 x m2. The procedure     ***/
00120 /***   should be implemented so that the argument matrix for the ***/
00121 /***   result m can be same as m1.                               ***/
00122 void matmult(matrix m, matrix m1, matrix m2)
00123 {
00124    vecmult(m[0], m1[0], m2);
00125    vecmult(m[1], m1[1], m2);
00126    vecmult(m[2], m1[2], m2);
00127    vecmult(m[3], m1[3], m2);
00128 }
00129 
00130 /*** Calculate the matrix difference m = m1 - m2. The procedure  ***/
00131 /***   should be implemented so that the argument matrix for the ***/
00132 /***   result m can be same as m1 or m2.                         ***/
00133 void matminus(matrix m, matrix m1, matrix m2)
00134 {
00135    int i, j;
00136 
00137    for (i = 0; i < 4; i++)
00138    {
00139       for (j = 0; j < 4; j++)
00140       {
00141          m[i][j] = m1[i][j] - m2[i][j];
00142       }
00143    }
00144 }
00145 
00146 /*** Calculate the matrix sum m = m1 + m2. The procedure         ***/
00147 /***   should be implemented so that the argument matrix for the ***/
00148 /***   result m can be same as m1 or m2.                         ***/
00149 void matplus(matrix m, matrix m1, matrix m2)
00150 {
00151    int i, j;
00152 
00153    for (i = 0; i < 4; i++)
00154    {
00155       for (j = 0; j < 4; j++)
00156       {
00157          m[i][j] = m1[i][j] + m2[i][j];
00158       }
00159    }
00160 }
00161 
00162 /* Refine an inversion matrix according to the method described in Faddejew  */
00163 /*  -Faddejewa: Numerische methoden fuer Lineare Algebra. Iterate until      */
00164 /*  required accuracy is achieved.                                           */
00165 void invrefine(matrix mat, matrix inv)
00166 {
00167    matrix R, M;
00168 
00169    matmult(M, mat, inv);
00170    matminus(R, I, M);
00171    matmult(M, inv, R);
00172    matplus(inv, M, inv);
00173 }
00174 
00175 /*** Make m an identity matrix                                   ***/
00176 void matident(matrix m)
00177 {
00178    m[0][0] = 1.0;
00179    m[1][0] = m[2][0] = m[3][0] = 0.0;
00180    m[1][1] = 1.0;
00181    m[0][1] = m[2][1] = m[3][1] = 0.0;
00182    m[2][2] = 1.0;
00183    m[0][2] = m[1][2] = m[3][2] = 0.0;
00184    m[3][3] = 1.0;
00185    m[0][3] = m[1][3] = m[2][3] = 0.0;
00186 }
00187 
00188 /*** Make m an identity matrix                                   ***/
00189 void matzer(matrix m)
00190 {
00191    m[0][0] = m[1][0] = m[2][0] = m[3][0] = 0.0;
00192    m[1][1] = m[0][1] = m[2][1] = m[3][1] = 0.0;
00193    m[2][2] = m[0][2] = m[1][2] = m[3][2] = 0.0;
00194    m[3][3] = m[0][3] = m[1][3] = m[2][3] = 0.0;
00195 }
00196 
00197 /* Test identity of matrix */
00198 int testident(matrix m, real eps)
00199 {
00200    int i, j;
00201 
00202    for (i = 0; i < 4; i++)
00203    {
00204       for (j = 0; j < 4; j++)
00205       {
00206          if (comp(m[i][j], (i == j) ? 1.0 : 0.0, eps) != 0)
00207          {
00208             return(FALSE);
00209          }
00210       }
00211    }
00212    return(SUCCESS);
00213 }
00214 
00215 /*** Combine a translation (tx, ty, tz) with m by constructing a ***/
00216 /***   translation matrix t from tx, ty and tz and multiplying m ***/
00217 /***   with t on the right.                                      ***/
00218 void mattrans(matrix m, real tx, real ty, real tz)
00219 {
00220    real b;
00221 
00222    b        = m[0][3];
00223    m[0][0] += b * tx;
00224    m[0][1] += b * ty;
00225    m[0][2] += b * tz;
00226    b        = m[1][3];
00227    m[1][0] += b * tx;
00228    m[1][1] += b * ty;
00229    m[1][2] += b * tz;
00230    b        = m[2][3];
00231    m[2][0] += b * tx;
00232    m[2][1] += b * ty;
00233    m[2][2] += b * tz;
00234    b        = m[3][3];
00235    m[3][0] += b * tx;
00236    m[3][1] += b * ty;
00237    m[3][2] += b * tz;
00238 }
00239 
00240 /*** Combine a rotation (rx, ry, rz) with m by  constructing  a  ***/
00241 /***   rotation matrix r from tx, ty and tz and multiplying m    ***/
00242 /***   with r on the right. If several rotations are specified,  ***/
00243 /***   they are applied in the order rx, ry, rz.                 ***/
00244 void matrotat(matrix mat, real rx, real ry, real rz)
00245 {
00246    real c, s, m, n;
00247 
00248    rx = rx * PI / 180.0;
00249    ry = ry * PI / 180.0;
00250    rz = rz * PI / 180.0;
00251    if (comp(rx, 0.0, EPS) != 0)
00252    {
00253       c         = cos(rx);
00254       s         = sin(rx);
00255       m         = mat[0][1];
00256       n         = mat[0][2];
00257       mat[0][1] = m * c - n * s;
00258       mat[0][2] = n * c + m * s;
00259       m         = mat[1][1];
00260       n         = mat[1][2];
00261       mat[1][1] = m * c - n * s;
00262       mat[1][2] = n * c + m * s;
00263       m         = mat[2][1];
00264       n         = mat[2][2];
00265       mat[2][1] = m * c - n * s;
00266       mat[2][2] = n * c + m * s;
00267       m         = mat[3][1];
00268       n         = mat[3][2];
00269       mat[3][1] = m * c - n * s;
00270       mat[3][2] = n * c + m * s;
00271    }
00272    if (comp(ry, 0.0, EPS) != 0)
00273    {
00274       c         = cos(ry);
00275       s         = sin(ry);
00276       m         = mat[0][0];
00277       n         = mat[0][2];
00278       mat[0][0] = m * c + n * s;
00279       mat[0][2] = n * c - m * s;
00280       m         = mat[1][0];
00281       n         = mat[1][2];
00282       mat[1][0] = m * c + n * s;
00283       mat[1][2] = n * c - m * s;
00284       m         = mat[2][0];
00285       n         = mat[2][2];
00286       mat[2][0] = m * c + n * s;
00287       mat[2][2] = n * c - m * s;
00288       m         = mat[3][0];
00289       n         = mat[3][2];
00290       mat[3][0] = m * c + n * s;
00291       mat[3][2] = n * c - m * s;
00292    }
00293    if (comp(rz, 0.0, EPS) != 0)
00294    {
00295       c         = cos(rz);
00296       s         = sin(rz);
00297       m         = mat[0][0];
00298       n         = mat[0][1];
00299       mat[0][0] = m * c - n * s;
00300       mat[0][1] = n * c + m * s;
00301       m         = mat[1][0];
00302       n         = mat[1][1];
00303       mat[1][0] = m * c - n * s;
00304       mat[1][1] = n * c + m * s;
00305       m         = mat[2][0];
00306       n         = mat[2][1];
00307       mat[2][0] = m * c - n * s;
00308       mat[2][1] = n * c + m * s;
00309       m         = mat[3][0];
00310       n         = mat[3][1];
00311       mat[3][0] = m * c - n * s;
00312       mat[3][1] = n * c + m * s;
00313    }
00314 }
00315 
00316 /*** Combine a scaling (sx, sy, sz) with m by constructing a     ***/
00317 /***   scaling matrix t from sx, sy and sz and multiplying m     ***/
00318 /***   with t on the right.                                      ***/
00319 /* Apply a scaling to matrix m */
00320 void matscale(matrix m, real sx, real sy, real sz)
00321 {
00322    m[0][0] *= sx;
00323    m[0][1] *= sy;
00324    m[0][2] *= sz;
00325    m[1][0] *= sx;
00326    m[1][1] *= sy;
00327    m[1][2] *= sz;
00328    m[2][0] *= sx;
00329    m[2][1] *= sy;
00330    m[2][2] *= sz;
00331    m[3][0] *= sx;
00332    m[3][1] *= sy;
00333    m[3][2] *= sz;
00334 }
00335 
00336 /* Copy matrix m2 to matrix m1 */
00337 void matcopy(matrix m1, matrix m2)
00338 {
00339    int i, j;
00340 
00341    for (i = 0; i < 4; i++)
00342    {
00343       for (j = 0; j < 4; j++)
00344       {
00345          m1[i][j] = m2[i][j];
00346       }
00347    }
00348 }
00349 
00350 /* Matrix multiplication res = m1 x m2 */
00351 /*** Calculate the vector-matrix product v1 = v2 x m. The        ***/
00352 /***   procedure should be implemented so that v1 can equal v2.  ***/
00353 void vecmult(vector v1, vector v2, matrix m)
00354 {
00355    vector v;
00356 
00357    v[0] = v2[0] * m[0][0] + v2[1] * m[1][0] + v2[2] * m[2][0] + v2[3] * m[3][0];
00358    v[1] = v2[0] * m[0][1] + v2[1] * m[1][1] + v2[2] * m[2][1] + v2[3] * m[3][1];
00359    v[2] = v2[0] * m[0][2] + v2[1] * m[1][2] + v2[2] * m[2][2] + v2[3] * m[3][2];
00360    v[3] = v2[0] * m[0][3] + v2[1] * m[1][3] + v2[2] * m[2][3] + v2[3] * m[3][3];
00361    veccopy(v1, v);
00362 }
00363 
00364 /* Print out a matrix */
00365 void matprint(matrix m)
00366 {
00367    int i, j;
00368 
00369    for (i = 0; i < 4; i++, printf("\n"))
00370    {
00371       for (j = 0; j < 4; j++)
00372       {
00373          printf("%f ", m[i][j]);
00374       }
00375    }
00376 }
00377 
00378 /* Transpose a matrix */
00379 void mattranspose(matrix m, matrix mtransp)
00380 {
00381    int    i, j;
00382    matrix tmp;
00383 
00384    for (i = 0; i < 4; ++i)
00385    {
00386       for (j = 0; j < 4; ++j)
00387       {
00388          tmp[i][j] = m[j][i];
00389       }
00390    }
00391    matcopy(mtransp, tmp);
00392 }

00394 /* Compare floating-point numbers with tolerance */
00395 int comp(real f1, real f2, real tol)
00396 {
00397    if (fabs(f1 - f2) < tol)
00398    {
00399       return(0);
00400    }
00401    if (f1 > f2)
00402    {
00403       return(1);
00404    }
00405    return(-1);
00406 }
00407 
00408 /* Make 4-vector out of components */
00409 real *makevec(vector v, real x, real y, real z, real w)
00410 {
00411    v[0] = x;
00412    v[1] = y;
00413    v[2] = z;
00414    v[3] = w;
00415    return(v);
00416 }

00418 /*** Calculate the dot (scalar) product of v1 and v2.            ***/
00419 real dot(vector v1, vector v2)
00420 {
00421    return(v1[0] * v2[0] + v1[1] * v2[1] + v1[2] * v2[2]);
00422 }
00423 
00424 /* Two-dimensional dot product -- "drop" gives the axis to be ignored */
00425 real dot2(vector v1, vector v2, int drop)
00426 {
00427    switch (drop)
00428    {
00429        case 0:
00430        return(v1[1] * v2[1] + v1[2] * v2[2]);
00431 
00432        case 1:
00433        return(v1[0] * v2[0] + v1[2] * v2[2]);
00434 
00435        case 2:
00436        return(v1[0] * v2[0] + v1[1] * v2[1]);
00437    }
00438    return(0.0);
00439 }
00440 
00441 /* Calculate Euclidean distance of two points */
00442 real vecd(vector v1, vector v2)
00443 {
00444    real dx, dy, dz;
00445 
00446    dx = v1[0] - v2[0];
00447    dy = v1[1] - v2[1];
00448    dz = v1[2] - v2[2];
00449    return(sqrt(dx * dx + dy * dy + dz * dz));
00450 }
00451 
00452 /* Is vec a null vector ? */
00453 int vecnull(vector v, real tol)
00454 {
00455    return(comp(dot(v, v), 0.0, tol) == 0);
00456 }
00457 
00458 /* Is the projection of vec a null vector ? */
00459 int vecnull2(vector vec, real eps, int drop)
00460 {
00461    int nulx, nuly, nulz;
00462 
00463    nulx = comp(vec[0], 0.0, eps);
00464    nuly = comp(vec[1], 0.0, eps);
00465    nulz = comp(vec[2], 0.0, eps);
00466    if ((drop == 0) && (nuly == 0) && (nulz == 0))
00467    {
00468       return(TRUE);
00469    }
00470    if ((drop == 1) && (nulx == 0) && (nulz == 0))
00471    {
00472       return(TRUE);
00473    }
00474    if ((drop == 2) && (nulx == 0) && (nuly == 0))
00475    {
00476       return(TRUE);
00477    }
00478    return(FALSE);
00479 }
00480 
00481 /*** Check whether vectors v1 and v2 are the same.               ***/
00482 int vecequal(vector v1, vector v2)
00483 {
00484    real dx, dy, dz, diff;
00485 
00486    dx   = v1[0] - v2[0];
00487    dy   = v1[1] - v2[1];
00488    dz   = v1[2] - v2[2];
00489    diff = dx * dx + dy * dy + dz * dz;
00490    return(comp(diff, 0.0, EPS * EPS) == 0);
00491 }
00492 
00493 /* Are vectors approximatively colinear ? */
00494 int veccolin(vector v1, vector v2, real eps)
00495 {
00496    vector tmp;
00497 
00498    return(vecnull(cross(tmp, v1, v2), eps));
00499 }
00500 
00501 /*** Calculate the cross (vector) product v1 = v2 x v3. The      ***/
00502 /***   procedure should be implemented so that the argument      ***/
00503 /***   vector for the result v1 can be the same as v2 or v3      ***/
00504 real *cross(vector v1, vector v2, vector v3)
00505 {
00506    vector v;
00507 
00508    v[0] = v2[1] * v3[2] - v2[2] * v3[1];
00509    v[1] = v2[2] * v3[0] - v2[0] * v3[2];
00510    v[2] = v2[0] * v3[1] - v2[1] * v3[0];
00511    v[3] = 1.0;
00512    return(veccopy(v1, v));
00513 }
00514 
00515 /*** Make v a unit vector, return its previous length            ***/
00516 char normalize(vector v)
00517 {
00518    real vl;
00519 
00520    vl = sqrt(dot(v, v));
00521    if (comp(vl, 0.0, EPS) != 0)
00522    {
00523       v[0] /= vl;
00524       v[1] /= vl;
00525       v[2] /= vl;
00526    }
00527    return(comp(vl, 0.0, EPS) != 0);
00528 }
00529 
00530 /*** Make v1 equal v2.                                           ***/
00531 real *veccopy(vector v1, vector v2)
00532 {
00533    v1[0] = v2[0];
00534    v1[1] = v2[1];
00535    v1[2] = v2[2];
00536    v1[3] = v2[3];
00537    return(v1);
00538 }
00539 
00540 /*** Let res = v1 - v2.                                          ***/
00541 real *vecminus(vector res, vector v1, vector v2)
00542 {
00543    int i;
00544 
00545    for (i = 0; i < 3; i++)
00546    {
00547       res[i] = v1[i] - v2[i];
00548    }
00549    res[3] = 1.0;
00550    return(res);
00551 }
00552 
00553 /*** Sum vectors v1 and v2 into res.                             ***/
00554 real *vecplus(vector res, vector v1, vector v2)
00555 {
00556    int i;
00557 
00558    for (i = 0; i < 3; i++)
00559    {
00560       res[i] = v1[i] + v2[i];
00561    }
00562    res[3] = 1.0;
00563    return(res);
00564 }
00565 
00566 /* Multiply vector by a scalar */
00567 void vecesc(vector v, vector ve, real k)
00568 {
00569    int i;
00570 
00571    for (i = 0; i < 3; i++)
00572    {
00573       v[i] = k * ve[i];
00574    }
00575    v[3] = 1.0;
00576 }
00577 
00578 /* Select largest absolute value of vec (for dropping) */
00579 int getdrop(vector vec)
00580 {
00581    real max, tmp;
00582    int  res;
00583 
00584    max = fabs(vec[0]);
00585    res = 0;
00586    if ((tmp = fabs(vec[1])) > max)
00587    {
00588       max = tmp;
00589       res = 1;
00590    }
00591    if (fabs(vec[2]) > max)
00592    {
00593       res = 2;
00594    }
00595    return(res);
00596 }

00599 /* Print out vector */
00600 void vecprint(vector v)
00601 {
00602    printf("%f %f %f %f\n", v[0], v[1], v[2], v[3]);
00603 }
00604 
00605 real *veczer(vector v)
00606 {
00607    v[0] = v[1] = v[2] = 0.0;
00608    v[3] = 1.0;
00609    return(v);
00610 }
00611 
00612 real *vecpe(vector vs, vector ve, vector v, real k)
00613 {
00614    int i;
00615 
00616    for (i = 0; i < 3; i++)
00617    {
00618       v[i] = ve[i] + k * vs[i];
00619    }
00620    v[3] = 1.0;
00621    return(v);
00622 }
00623 
00624 real *calc_p(vector v1, vector v2, real t, vector v)
00625 {
00626    int i;
00627 
00628    for (i = 0; i < 3; i++)
00629    {
00630       v[i] = (v1[i] - v2[i]) * t + v2[i];
00631    }
00632    v[3] = 1.0;
00633    return(v);
00634 }
00635 
00636 real *vec2cp(vector v, vector o)
00637 {
00638    v[0] = o[0];
00639    v[1] = o[1];
00640    v[2] = o[2];
00641    return(v);
00642 }
00643 
00644 real vecd2(vector v1, vector v2)
00645 {
00646    real dx, dy;
00647 
00648    dx = v1[0] - v2[0];
00649    dy = v1[1] - v2[1];
00650    return(sqrt(dx * dx + dy * dy));
00651 }
00652 
00653 void rotmat(vector axis, real th, matrix rot)
00654 {
00655    real dth;
00656    real cx, sx, dx, r1, r2, r3, r12, r13, r23;
00657 
00658    dth = th;
00659    cx  = cos(dth);
00660    sx  = sin(dth);
00661    dx  = 1.0 - cx;
00662    r1  = axis[0];
00663    r2  = axis[1];
00664    r3  = axis[2];
00665    r12 = r1 * r2;
00666    r13 = r1 * r3;
00667    r23 = r2 * r3;
00668 
00669    matident(rot);
00670    rot[0][0] = cx + dx * r1 * r1;
00671    rot[0][1] = sx * r3 + dx * r12;
00672    rot[0][2] = -sx * r2 + dx * r13;
00673 
00674    rot[1][0] = -sx * r3 + dx * r12;
00675    rot[1][1] = cx + dx * r2 * r2;
00676    rot[1][2] = sx * r1 + dx * r23;
00677 
00678    rot[2][0] = sx * r2 + dx * r13;
00679    rot[2][1] = -sx * r1 + dx * r23;
00680    rot[2][2] = cx + dx * r3 * r3;
00681 }
